ds.made.jdbc.easy.utility

Class NamedParameterCallableStatement

  • java.lang.Object
    • ds.made.jdbc.easy.utility.NamedParameterCallableStatement

  • public class NamedParameterCallableStatement
extends java.lang.Object
    This class wraps around a CallableStatement and allows the programmer to set parameters by name instead of by index. This eliminates any confusion as to which parameter index represents what. This also means that rearranging the SQL call statement or adding a parameter doesn't involve renumbering your indices.

    Made from the NamedParameterPreparedStatement template.
    Author:
    ds

      • NamedParameterCallableStatement

        public NamedParameterCallableStatement(java.sql.Connection connection,
                               java.lang.String command)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a NamedParameterStatement. Wraps a call to c.prepareStatement.
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        query - the parameterized query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the statement could not be created

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the statement, which must be an SQL INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE statement; or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as a DDL statement.
        Returns:
        number of rows affected
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurred
        See Also:
        PreparedStatement.executeUpdate()

      • close

           throws java.sql.SQLException

        Closes all Blobs and Clobs!

        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurred
